analysis.raw_analysis:
1) TRANSFORMATION TYPE: Pure translation of the colored shape(s); input/output grid sizes identical and object sizes unchanged.

2) PATTERN: The connected region of color 2 is translated (no rotation/flip) until it is orthogonally adjacent (touching edge-to-edge) to the fixed 2x2 color-8 block; color 8 and background (0) stay put.

3) KEY CHANGES:
- Ex1: color2 shifted right 3 cols to abut color8; 8 unchanged.
- Ex2: color2 shifted down 6 rows to abut color8 from above; 8 unchanged.
- Ex3: color2 shifted up 3 rows to abut color8 from below; 8 unchanged.

=== INPUT-INPUT COMPARISONS ===
- Same: each input has one connected region of color 2 and one 2x2 block of color 8; the color-2 shape/orientation is identical across examples.
- Different: their relative positions (offsets) vary.

=== OUTPUT-OUTPUT COMPARISONS ===
- Exactly same: every output leaves the color-8 2x2 block in place and preserves the color-2 shape and all other pixels.

=== INPUT-OUTPUT COMPARISONS ===
- Rule: translate the connected color-2 region (no rotation/flip) so it becomes adjacent (shares a side) to the color-8 2x2 block without overlapping; color-8 unchanged.

Reference objects: The two colored regions (the irregular color-2 connected shape and the 2x2 color-8 block) remain identical in shape, size and color -- they are the anchors that determine the move.

Grid pattern: A uniform pure translation is applied to both objects together; their relative offset/orientation is preserved.

Objects: The key recurring objects are the irregular color-2 polyomino and the 2x2 color-8 square; the transformation copies/translates them as a pair.

=== GENERAL RULE ===
1. Step 1: IF there exists a contiguous 2x2 block composed of color 8 (four orthogonally adjacent cells forming a square) THEN do not move or recolor any of those color-8 cells (treat the 2x2 color-8 block as a fixed anchor).  
2. Step 2: IF there exists a single connected region composed solely of color 2 cells (one connected color-2 object) THEN treat that connected region as one rigid object and preserve its exact shape and color (do not rotate or reflect it).  
3. Step 3: IF the color-2 object's bounding box satisfies max_col_of_color2 < min_col_of_the_2x2_color8_block THEN translate the entire connected color-2 object right (no rotation/flip) until max_col_of_color2 = min_col_of_the_2x2_color8_block - 1 (i.e., until some color-2 cell is orthogonally adjacent edge-to-edge to the left side of the 2x2 color-8 block).  
4. Step 4: IF the color-2 object's bounding box satisfies min_col_of_color2 > max_col_of_the_2x2_color8_block THEN translate the entire connected color-2 object left (no rotation/flip) until min_col_of_color2 = max_col_of_the_2x2_color8_block + 1 (i.e., until some color-2 cell is orthogonally adjacent edge-to-edge to the right side of the 2x2 color-8 block).  
5. Step 5: IF the color-2 object's bounding box satisfies max_row_of_color2 < min_row_of_the_2x2_color8_block THEN translate the entire connected color-2 object down (no rotation/flip) until max_row_of_color2 = min_row_of_the_2x2_color8_block - 1 (i.e., until some color-2 cell is orthogonally adjacent edge-to-edge above the 2x2 color-8 block).  
6. Step 6: IF the color-2 object's bounding box satisfies min_row_of_color2 > max_row_of_the_2x2_color8_block THEN translate the entire connected color-2 object up (no rotation/flip) until min_row_of_color2 = max_row_of_the_2x2_color8_block + 1 (i.e., until some color-2 cell is orthogonally adjacent edge-to-edge below the 2x2 color-8 block).  
7. Step 7: IF any other cells (colors other than 2 or 8, including background 0) are present in the grid THEN leave those cells unchanged.

general_steps.instruction: Step 1: TRANSFORM - Step 1: IF there exists a contiguous 2x2 block composed of color 8 (four orthogonally adjacent cells forming a square) THEN do not move or recolor any of those color-8 cells (treat the 2x2 color-8 block as a fixed anchor).

Step 2: TRANSFORM - Step 2: IF there exists a single connected region composed solely of color 2 cells (one connected color-2 object) THEN treat that connected region as one rigid object and preserve its exact shape and color (do not rotate or reflect it).

Step 3: TRANSFORM - Step 3: IF the color-2 object's bounding box satisfies max_col_of_color2 < min_col_of_the_2x2_color8_block THEN translate the entire connected color-2 object right (no rotation/flip) until max_col_of_color2 = min_col_of_the_2x2_color8_block - 1 (i.e., until some color-2 cell is orthogonally adjacent edge-to-edge to the left side of the 2x2 color-8 block).

Step 4: TRANSFORM - Step 4: IF the color-2 object's bounding box satisfies min_col_of_color2 > max_col_of_the_2x2_color8_block THEN translate the entire connected color-2 object left (no rotation/flip) until min_col_of_color2 = max_col_of_the_2x2_color8_block + 1 (i.e., until some color-2 cell is orthogonally adjacent edge-to-edge to the right side of the 2x2 color-8 block).

Step 5: TRANSFORM - Step 5: IF the color-2 object's bounding box satisfies max_row_of_color2 < min_row_of_the_2x2_color8_block THEN translate the entire connected color-2 object down (no rotation/flip) until max_row_of_color2 = min_row_of_the_2x2_color8_block - 1 (i.e., until some color-2 cell is orthogonally adjacent edge-to-edge above the 2x2 color-8 block).

Step 6: TRANSFORM - Step 6: IF the color-2 object's bounding box satisfies min_row_of_color2 > max_row_of_the_2x2_color8_block THEN translate the entire connected color-2 object up (no rotation/flip) until min_row_of_color2 = max_row_of_the_2x2_color8_block + 1 (i.e., until some color-2 cell is orthogonally adjacent edge-to-edge below the 2x2 color-8 block).
Step 7: OBSERVE - Step 7: IF any other cells (colors other than 2 or 8, including background 0) are present in the grid THEN leave those cells unchanged.
